Description.val:
The E-2D Advanced Hawkeye (AHE) is an all-weather, twin engine, carrier-based, Airborne Command, Control and Surveillance aircraft designed to extend task force defense perimeters.  The AHE mission is to provide advance warning of approaching enemy surface units and aircraft, to vector interceptors or strike aircraft to attack, and to provide area surveillance, intercept, search and rescue, communications relay, and strike/air traffic control.  Key AHE objectives include: improved battle space target detection and situational awareness, especially in the littorals; support of Theater Air Missile Defense operations; and improved Operational Availability.

**Controls locked prior to updating the "To Complete" Cost.  In order to reflect the correct Program funding profile, supporting exhibits reflect actual "To Complete" Cost.  To match the supporting exhibits, the P-40 should have a "To Complete" Total Obligation Authority of:  
(in millions)
Gross/Weapon System Cost      4266.923
Less PY Advanced Procurement  -483.978
Net Procurement (P1)          3782.945
Plus CY Advance Procurement    284.352
Total Obligation Authority    4067.297

Approved for Full Rate Production, will IOC in 1QFY15.

Justification.val: FY 2014 funding is requested to procure five E-2D AHE Low Rate Initial Production aircraft and their associated support.

Name.@footnote: FY14-18 Nonrecurring Costs includes funding for Avionics Obsolescence to address emergent component obsolescence issues by way of Weapons Replaceable Assemblies (WRAs) and software redesign and integration; and Anti-Tamper (AT) software incorporation to include integration and test on all applicable E-2D WRAs to ensure protection of critical E-2D war-fighting capabilities; and Software Support Activity (SSA) for E-2D Mission Computer Display (MCD) software life cycle support; and Cost Reduction Initiative funding of $35 million.

Airframe PGSE increases in FY14 due to the procurement of equipment to support additional sites (west coast and forward deployed) to support transitioning squadrons as well as develop and procure the phases of Depot Equipment to support Title 10 (Organic Depot).

Engine PGSE increases in FY14 are due to the procurement of equipment to support additional sites (west coast and forward deployed) to support transitioning squadrons as well as develop and procure the phases of Depot Equipment to support Title 10 (Organic Depot).

Avionics PGSE increases in FY14 are due to the procurement of equipment to support additional sites (west coast and forward deployed) to support transitioning squadrons as well as develop and procure the phases of Depot Equipment to support Title 10 (Organic Depot).
Peculiar Training Equipment increases in FY14 are due to the procurement of Weapon System Trainers (WST) for Pt. Mugu.
Pubs/Tech Data increases in FY14 are due to the development and procurement of publications to support Depot Equipment and repair capabilities.
Production Engineering Support increases in FY14 as program support transitions to production.
ILS increases in FY14 due to the requirement to provide additional support to oversee the development of depot capability.
